newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi shares continue upward trend, banks dominate.
newsitem.headline: Saudi shares continue upward trend, banks dominate.

text.p: Saudi shares gained about two percent in the week to Wednesday in moderate trade focused on bank shares, the Riyadh-based Bakheet Financial Advisors (BFA) said on Saturday.
The all-share index closed at 178.8 points from 175.34 points the previous week.
Of the 62 shares traded in the week, 53 rose, five fell and four were unchanged.
Bank shares accounted for about 53 percent of the week's total trading value which BFA put at 1.088 billion riyals ($290 million), down from 1.75 billion a week earlier.
BFA said 4.9 million shares changed hands in the week down from 7.4 million shares in the previous week.

Tabuk Agriculture Co was the week's major gainer with an eight percent increase to 95 riyals from 88 riyals a week earlier. SCECO-Eastern closed seven riyals higher at 107 riyals and Tabuk Electricity at 92 riyals from 87 riyals.
ZOUJAJ lost 9.6 percent to 150 from a previous 166 riyals and Saudi Industrial Export Co ended the week nine riyals lower at 136 riyals from 145 riyals.
